body:

#### 3. Fix sidebar sticky error in Infrastructure Detail page

after:

## Please ensure all items are checked off before requesting a review. "Checked off" means you need to add an "x" character between brackets so they turn into checkmarks.

- [x] (Do not skip this or your PR will be closed) I deployed the application locally.
- [x] (Do not skip this or your PR will be closed) I have performed a self-review and testing of my code.
- [ ] I have included the issue # in the PR.
- [x] I have labelled the PR correctly.
- [ ] The issue I am working on is assigned to me.
- [x] I didn't use any hardcoded values (otherwise it will not scale, and will make it difficult to maintain consistency across the application).
- [x] I made sure font sizes, color choices etc are all referenced from the theme.
- [x] My PR is granular and targeted to one specific feature.
- [x] I took a screenshot or a video and attached to this PR if there is a UI change.

# Auto Pull Request Review from LlamaPReview

## Review Status: Automated Review Skipped

Dear contributor,

Thank you for your Pull Request. LlamaPReview has analyzed your changes and determined that this PR does not require an automated code review.

### Analysis Result:
PR contains only UI styling changes with no impact on core logic, functionality, or security. It is well-covered by tests and has clear scope.

We're continuously improving our PR analysis capabilities. Have thoughts on when and how LlamaPReview should perform automated reviews? Share your insights in our [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/JetXu-LLM/LlamaPReview-site/discussions).

Best regards,
LlamaPReview Team

**Actionable comments posted: 3**

🔇 Additional comments (1)
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/index.jsx (1) `108-108`: **Mom's spaghetti alert! There's a TODO that needs cleaning up! 🍝** Let's remove that TODO comment and clean up any unnecessary styles in the CSS class. Could you share what specific styles in `current-monitors-counter` need to be removed? Let me help you find those unnecessary styles:

Looks great, thanks for your contribution!

I don't know what cross browser comaptibility is with regards to using `infinity`.

It would be safer and identical for all intents and purpsoses to use a sufficiently large value instead of infinity.

**Actionable comments posted: 0**
🧹 Nitpick comments (2)
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Home/index.jsx (2)
Line range hint `166-175`: **Heads up! That focus-visible TODO needs some love 🔍** There's a TODO comment indicating that the focus-visible styles should be applied to all buttons. This is crucial for accessibility. Would you like me to help create a reusable button component or theme configuration that applies these focus styles consistently across all buttons? --- Line range hint `190-206`: **Keep it DRY - StatusBox repetition spotted 🍜** The StatusBox components are repeated with similar structure but different props. Consider mapping over an array of status configs. ```diff + const statusConfigs = [ + { title: 'up', value: monitorsSummary?.upMonitors ?? 0 }, + { title: 'down', value: monitorsSummary?.downMonitors ?? 0 }, + { title: 'paused', value: monitorsSummary?.pausedMonitors ?? 0 } + ]; - - - + {statusConfigs.map(config => ( + + ))} ```
📜 Review details **Configuration used: .coderabbit.yaml** **Review profile: CHILL** **Plan: Pro**

📒 Files selected for processing (2) * `Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/index.jsx` (3 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Home/index.jsx` (1 hunks)
🚧 Files skipped from review as they are similar to previous changes (1) * Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/index.jsx
🔇 Additional comments (1)
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Home/index.jsx (1) `74-74`: **Yo, this color logic simplification looks clean! 🍝** The removal of the redundant condition makes the code more straightforward while maintaining the same functionality. The thresholds are now: - < 25%: error.main - < 50%: warning.main - ≥ 50%: success.main However, let's verify these thresholds align with design requirements.
✅ Verification successful **Yo dawg, these color thresholds are straight fire! 🔥** The color logic is consistent across components with clear thresholds: - < 25%: Red (error) - < 50%: Yellow (warning) - ≥ 50%: Green (success) The simplified code maintains the same functionality while being more maintainable. Tests confirm correct percentage calculations.
🏁 Scripts executed The following scripts were executed for the analysis: Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Search for similar percentage-based color logic in other components rg -A 3 'uptimePercentage.*palette\.(error|warning|success)' ``` Length of output: 62 --- Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Search for theme.palette usage near percentage conditions rg -U "theme\.palette\.(success|error|warning).*\d+%|percentage.*theme\.palette" -A 3 -B 3 # Search for any percentage-based conditions rg -U "(\d+%|percentage.*<.*\d+)" -A 3 -B 3 # Look for color-related helper functions ast-grep --pattern 'function $_(percentage) { $$$ theme.palette $$$ }' ``` Length of output: 67031

Looks good, thank you for discussing some change :+1: 

Appreciate your contribution to the project!

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: summarize by coderabbit.ai -->




<!-- walkthrough_start -->

## Walkthrough

The pull request introduces consistent styling modifications across multiple components in the client-side application. Specifically, the changes focus on altering the `borderRadius` property from a standard `"50%"` to an unconventional `"10000px"` in three different React components: Infrastructure, PageSpeed, and UptimeDataTable. Additionally, the PageSpeed component includes updates to border thickness, color, and typography adjustments. The logic for determining colors based on uptime percentages has also been simplified in the UptimeMonitors component.

## Changes

| File | Change Summary |
|------|----------------|
| `Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/index.jsx` | Modified `borderRadius` from `"50%"` to `"10000px"`; removed `IconButton` wrapping for `InfrastructureMenu`; simplified `percentageColor` logic. |
| `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/index.jsx` | Increased border thickness from 1 to 2; changed border color; added new styles including `borderRadius: 10000px`, padding, font size, and font weight. |
| `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Home/UptimeDataTable/index.jsx` | Modified `borderRadius` from `"50%"` to `"10000px"`. |
| `Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/Details/index.jsx` | Changed `direction` prop from `direction={"row"}` to `direction="row"` (syntactical modification). |
| `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Home/index.jsx` | Simplified logic for determining `percentageColor` in `getMonitorWithPercentage` function. |

## Possibly related PRs

- #1638: The changes in the `CreateMonitor` component involve UI modifications that may relate to the overall styling and presentation of components, similar to the updates made to the `Infrastructure` component's visual elements in the main PR.

## Suggested labels

`design`, `frontend`

## Suggested reviewers

- ajhollid
- danielcj2

<details>
<summary>🪧 Tips</summary>

### Chat

There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai):

> ‼️ **IMPORTANT**
> Auto-reply has been disabled for this repository in the CodeRabbit settings. The CodeRabbit bot will not respond to your replies unless it is explicitly tagged.
- Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai generate unit testing code for this file.`
  -	`@coderabbitai modularize this function.`
- PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.`
  - `@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and generate unit testing code.`
  - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.`
  - `@coderabbitai help me debug CodeRabbit configuration file.`

Note: Be mindful of the bot's finite context window. It's strongly recommended to break down tasks such as reading entire modules into smaller chunks. For a focused discussion, use review comments to chat about specific files and their changes, instead of using the PR comments.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR comments)

- `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR.
- `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews.
- `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai full review` to do a full review from scratch and review all the files again.
- `@coderabbitai summary` to regenerate the summary of the PR.
- `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to [generate docstrings](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/finishing-touches/docstrings) for this PR. ([Beta](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/early-access#beta))
- `@coderabbitai resolve` resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments.
- `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai help` to get help.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

### Documentation and Community

- Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit.
- Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback.
- Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

</details>

<!-- tips_end -->

UI-wise looks good to me ! @YinDongFang 

Thank you for your contribution. Let's wait for Alex for a review next week.

> The new commit fixes #1639

@YinDongFang what was causing the issue in #1639?

> > The new commit fixes #1639
> 
> @YinDongFang what was causing the issue in #1639?

There are no color definitions of `theme.palette.percentage`. 

Some changes before modified colors in `Uptime` page, but miss `Infrastructure` page. It's just frontend error

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2e3a6df5-0064-47d5-9820-37bc3a29965e)

> I change `Infrastructure` by copy from `Uptime` in my commit.

Understood, yes there are some missing colors after a refactor.

Let's go with this for now, generating the colors for various percentages should probably eventually be refactored out so we have one source of truth for colors.

Thanks!
